intro: Justicia petiolaris, commonly known as the red mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly rough texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value.
